docs.lead_paragraph: Like thousands of other New Yorkers, Jason Henkle throws a leg over a bicycle every day and pedals to work. Unlike most of his fellow riders, Mr. Henkle built his understated single-speed bike by hand.
docs.abstract: A growing number of New York bicycling enthusiasts have taken up the challenge of constructing their own bike frames.
docs.snippet: A growing number of New York bicycling enthusiasts have taken up the challenge of constructing their own bike frames....

docs.lead_paragraph: Computer scientists may have the best skills — they can use machines, algorithms and the wisdom of the crowd — to fight cancer.
docs.abstract: Essay by David Patterson of the University of California, Berkeley, contends computer scientists are essential in fight against cancer; asserts their skills could be used to drive down cost of technology required to sequence the DNA of tumors, and develop advanced databases to organize sequences and make them available to scientists and health professionals.
docs.snippet: Computer scientists may have the best skills — they can use machines, algorithms and the wisdom of the crowd — to fight cancer....

headline.print_headline: Computer Scientists May Have What It Takes to Help Cure Cancer
headline.seo: David Patterson: Enlist Computer Scientists in Cancer Fight

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS; Lily Koppel contributed reporting for this article

docs.lead_paragraph: Five young Manhattan men were charged yesterday with running a business that sold fake New York State driver's licenses and Ecstasy out of a luxury East Side apartment building. As a sideline, they also sold a bit of cocaine, the authorities said. The friends, who range in age from 20 to 17, were arrested over the course of the week after an undercover detective bought 200 doses of Ecstasy, a half-ounce of cocaine and a fistful of counterfeit driver's licenses that he later described as clumsily executed.
docs.snippet: Five young Manhattan men were charged Friday with selling fake New York State driver's licenses and Ecstasy out of a luxury East Side apartment building....

headline.main: Five Charged In Sales Of Ecstasy And Licenses

docs.lead_paragraph: IT'S February and it's freezing, but brochures and applications for summer camps and programs have arrived in mailboxes across the state. It may seem an odd time to even think about summer, but winter is when applications come pouring in to camp administrators and the programs begin to fill up. ''At least half the camps we represent were filled by Christmas,'' said Bette Horowitz of Student Camp and Trip Advisors of Woodbridge. ''But that doesn't mean there aren't good places to go.''

headline.main: Frozen Out Of Summer Camp Before the Lake Thaws
